title: Google Sheets SUMIF Function

metadata.description: Learn about Google Sheets SUMIF Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Google Sheets SUMIF Function

SUMIF Function
The
SUMIF
function is a premade function in Google Sheets
content_sections.content:
, which calculates the sum of values in a range based on a
true
or
false
condition
.

content_sections.title: It is typed
content_sections.content:
=SUMIF
:
=SUMIF(
range
,
criterion
,
[sum_range]
)
The
condition
is referred to as
criterion
, which can check things like:
If a number is
greater than
another number
>
If a number is
smaller than
another number
<

content_sections.title:
If a number or text is
equal
to something
content_sections.content:
=
The
[sum_range]
is the range where the function calculates the sum.
Note:
The
[sum_range]
is optional.
If not specified, the function calculates the sum of the same range as the condition.
Example SUMIF function
Find the sum of Total stats for Grass type Pokemon:
The condition is that the type is "Grass".
Name	Type 1	Total			
    Bulbasaur	Grass	318		Type	Total Sum
    Ivysaur	Grass	405		Grass	
    Venusaur	Grass	525		Fire	
    Charmander	Fire	309		Water	
    Charmeleon	Fire	405			
    Charizard	Fire	534			
    Squirtle	Water	314			
    Wartortle	Water	405			
    Blastoise	Water	530
Copy Values
Example
SUMIF
function, step by step:
Select the cell
F3

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=SUMIF
Click the
SUMIF
command
Specify the range for the condition
B2:B10
(the Type 1 values)
Type
,
Specify the criteria (the cell
E3
, which has the value "Grass")
Type
,
Specify the range for the sum
C2:C10
(the Total values)
Type
,
Hit enter
The function now sums the Total stats for Grass type Pokemon.
The function can be repeated for the other Pokemon types to compare them:
Note:
You can use the
filling function
for the other rows, but make sure to use
absolute references
for the ranges.
Now, we can see the sum of total stats for the different types of Pokemon:

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
Name	Type 1	Total			
    Bulbasaur	Grass	318		Type	Total Sum
    Ivysaur	Grass	405		Grass	
    Venusaur	Grass	525		Fire	
    Charmander	Fire	309		Water	
    Charmeleon	Fire	405			
    Charizard	Fire	534			
    Squirtle	Water	314			
    Wartortle	Water	405			
    Blastoise	Water	530

summary: This tutorial covers Google Sheets SUMIF Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Google Sheets SUMIF Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Google Sheets SUMIF Function and how to apply it in your projects.
